meanings.definition: Showing a feeling of shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: She looked shamefaced after spilling her drink at the party.
meanings.sent2: The student was shamefaced when caught cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed shamefaced after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky had a shamefaced appearance before the storm.
meanings.sent5: His shamefaced expression told us he had made a big mistake.

meanings.definition: Having a bashful or modest appearance.
meanings.sent1: The shy child had a shamefaced look when meeting new people.
meanings.sent2: She gave a shamefaced smile when complimented on her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's shamefaced behavior made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden had a shamefaced charm in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: His shamefaced demeanor made him endearing to everyone he met.
